title: Uncle - definition of uncle by The Free Dictionary
text: uncle Also found in: Thesaurus, Medical, Acronyms, Idioms, Encyclopedia, Wikipedia. un·cle (ŭng′kəl)n. Idiom: 1. a. The brother of one's mother or father. b. The husband of a sibling of one's mother or father. 2. Used as a form of address for an older man, especially by children. 3. A kindly counselor. 4. Slang A pawnbroker. 5. Uncle Uncle Sam. cry/say uncle Informal To indicate a willingness to give up a fight or surrender: tickled my brother until he cried uncle. [Middle English, from Anglo-Norman, from Latin avunculus, maternal uncle; see awo- in Indo-European roots.] American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, Fifth Edition. (cap.) Uncle Sam. Idioms: say or cry uncle, to concede defeat.
